title: Trying to import openssh ecdsa-sk key results in unexpected AttributeError exception
body:
When trying to import an openssh key of the ecdsa-sk type (that appears to be some security token key), I get this error:
```
  File "/tmp/./foo.py", line 20, in <module>
    load_ssh_private_key(key, password=None)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.12/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/serialization/ssh.py", line 696, in load_ssh_private_key
    pubfields, pubdata = kformat.get_public(pubdata)
                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: '_SSHFormatSKECDSA' object has no attribute 'get_public'. Did you mean: 'load_public'?
```

This is unexpected,as the documentation does not mention that an AttributeError can occur with load_ssh_private_key: https://cryptography.io/en/latest/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/serialization/#cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization.load_ssh_private_key

If the key is malformed, it should result in a ValueError, if it is not supported, it should throw UnsupportedAlgorithm.

Here's a test key from openssh:
https://github.com/openssh/openssh-portable/blob/master/regress/unittests/sshsig/testdata/ecdsa_sk

Example code trying to import that key:
```
#!/usr/bin/python3

from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization import load_ssh_private_key

key = """-----BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY-----
b3BlbnNzaC1rZXktdjEAAAAABG5vbmUAAAAEbm9uZQAAAAAAAAABAAAAfwAAACJzay1lY2
RzYS1zaGEyLW5pc3RwMjU2QG9wZW5zc2guY29tAAAACG5pc3RwMjU2AAAAQQSg1WuY0XE+
VexOsrJsFYuxyVoe6eQ/oXmyz2pEHKZw9moyWehv+Fs7oZWFp3JVmOtybKQ6dvfUZYauQE
/Ov4PAAAAABHNzaDoAAAGI6iV41+oleNcAAAAic2stZWNkc2Etc2hhMi1uaXN0cDI1NkBv
cGVuc3NoLmNvbQAAAAhuaXN0cDI1NgAAAEEEoNVrmNFxPlXsTrKybBWLsclaHunkP6F5ss
9qRBymcPZqMlnob/hbO6GVhadyVZjrcmykOnb31GWGrkBPzr+DwAAAAARzc2g6AQAAAOMt
LS0tLUJFR0lOIEVDIFBSSVZBVEUgS0VZLS0tLS0KTUhjQ0FRRUVJQm9oeW54M2tpTFVEeS
t5UjU3WXBXSU5KektnU1p6WnV2VTljYXFla3JGcW9Bb0dDQ3FHU000OQpBd0VIb1VRRFFn
QUVvTlZybU5GeFBsWHNUckt5YkJXTHNjbGFIdW5rUDZGNXNzOXFSQnltY1BacU1sbm9iL2
hiCk82R1ZoYWR5VlpqcmNteWtPbmIzMUdXR3JrQlB6citEd0E9PQotLS0tLUVORCBFQyBQ
UklWQVRFIEtFWS0tLS0tCgAAAAAAAAARRUNEU0EtU0sgdGVzdCBrZXk=
-----END OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY-----
""".encode()

load_ssh_private_key(key, password=None)
```
